inflection noun
(GRAMMAR)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ]
  language
  specialized a change in or addition to the form of a word that shows a change in the way it is used in sentences: If you add the plural inflection "-s" to "dog" you get "dogs".
More examplesFewer examplesIn the present tense we say "he sits", because the third person singular inflection of the verb is -s.By adding the inflection "-ed", you form the past tense of the verb.

inflection noun
(SPEECH)
[ C or U ] the way in which the sound of your voice changes during speech, for example when you emphasize particular words: His voice was low and flat, with almost no inflection.

[ U ] change in the quality of the voice, often showing an emotion: Phyllis replies without any particular inflection in her voice, "I guess I’m lazy."
inflection noun
(GRAMMAR)
[ C ]
  grammar a change in a word form or ending to show a difference in the word’s meaning or use: "Gets," "got," and "gotten" are inflections of the verb "get."
